item.description:
Calm Your Body, Calm Your Mind

Join us for a finals edition of a relaxing hour of gentle movement and guided relaxation to release tension with time to sit in quiet reflection or meditation to calm your mind. All bodies and abilities are welcome… practice on a yoga mat, in a chair, or wheelchair. Whatever works for you! No previous experience necessary and props will be provided. If you’d like to bring your own yoga or exercise mat, feel free to do so. Snacks and drinks available after class.

item.title: Philosophy, Politics, and Economics Club Weekly Meeting
item.description:
Philosophy, Politics, and Economics Club Weekly Meeting

The purpose of the Philosophy, Politics, and Economics (PPE) Club is to provide a space for the open discussion of topics related to the intersection of philosophy, political science, and economics and foster an intellectual community based on mutual respect and curiosity. Join us each week for great conversations about unique topics, lots of fun, and a community like no other on campus (and also pizza).

PPE Club is open to people of all majors and disciplines. Regardless of your background, knowledge of the topics, or future aspirations, PPE Club has something for everyone! PPE Club also serves to connect students with the academic and professional opportunities that are available for those passionate about the humanities and social sciences. Students have made connections through PPE Club that led them to research opportunities, internships, and more. We hope to see you there!

From Thursday, December 11, 2025 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM EST at SU 210 Landmark Room.

Weekly Friday Night Meeting - International Students, Inc

We play fun games and sing spiritual songs together!

You get to learn about God and talk about God in small groups.

We welcome everyone (of all religious backgrounds)!

This is a great way to meet new people and make new friends!

item.title: H2O Sunday Service
item.description:
H2O Sunday Service
 

The purpose of our Sunday Service is to gather together to worship God as a family. We believe that it is not just a meeting, but an opportunity to hear from God through His Word and through others. No matter where you are in your faith journey, you are welcome to join us as you are every Sunday.

You can expect:

  • Authentic worship music so that we may praise Him together
  • Solid Biblical teaching that applies to your life
  • Real stories about what God is doing in people’s lives
  • Conversation and fellowship before and after each gathering

Our Sunday Services are at 10:30am on campus every week! 

From Sunday, December 14, 2025 10:30 AM to 11:45 AM EST at su 330.
item.author: h2ochurchbuffalo@gmail.com (H2O Church)

item.title: End-of-Semester Showcase
item.description:
End-of-Semester Showcase

Our end-of-semester showcase, where all of our dancers will get to perform and show off their hardwork!

From Sunday, December 14, 2025 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM EST at Center for the Arts.

item.title: Calm Your Body, Calm Your Mind
item.description:
Calm Your Body, Calm Your Mind

Join us for a finals edition of a relaxing hour of gentle movement and guided relaxation to release tension with time to sit in quiet reflection or meditation to calm your mind. All bodies and abilities are welcome… practice on a yoga mat, in a chair, or wheelchair. Whatever works for you! No previous experience necessary and props will be provided. If you’d like to bring your own yoga or exercise mat, feel free to do so. Snacks and drinks available after class.

From Monday, December 15, 2025 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM EST at Harriman Ballroom.
item.author: stu-programs@buffalo.edu (Accessibility Resources)

item.title: Community Assistant Information Session
item.description:
Community Assistant Information Session
Come to an Information Session to learn more about the Community Assistant (CA) position for the 2026–2027 academic year at the University at Buffalo! This session will cover everything you need to know about the role, including responsibilities, renumeration, and how to apply. Being a CA is a great opportunity to build leadership skills, connect with the campus community, and make a positive impact in UB’s residence halls and apartments. Whether you're seriously considering applying or just want to explore your options, this session is a great place to start!
 
The Community Assistant (CA) is previously known as Resident Assistant (RA) and Academic Assistant (AA).

From Monday, December 15, 2025 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM EST at Online.

item.title: Finals Week Body Doubling
item.description:
Finals Week Body Doubling

Join Accessibility Resources in body doubling sessions every night during finals week. Body doubling is a productive strategy in which people work alongside each other to complete tasks that they might otherwise find challenging. Join virtually and work with other students, helping you focus on your tasks. 

From Monday, December 15, 2025 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM EST at Online.

item.title: Graduate Christian Fellowship (Cancelled)
item.description:
Graduate Christian Fellowship

The Graduate Christian Fellowship (GCF) at UB is a welcoming community of graduate students, professional students, and post-docs who are curious about Jesus and what his life, death, and resurrection mean for our work and for the world.

 

This semester, we are reading the book of Colossians, a letter that invites us to see all of life (our studies, our relationships, our work, and our world) through the lens of Christ. Written to a young community learning to follow Jesus in a complex cultural moment, Colossians speaks with surprising clarity to our own questions of identity, purpose, and hope.

From Tuesday, December 16, 2025 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Online.
item.author: chris.sullivan@intervarsity.org (Intervarsity Christian Fellowship)

item.title: Donuts with the Dean
item.description:
Donuts with the Dean

We will be hosting our next Donuts with the Dean on Friday, January 23rd from 9 am to 10:30 am. Dr. Seshadri will be in attendance to share updates and field questions regarding the graduate program. Please do your best to attend, as this event is designed to foster communication between our student body and OCET. 

Please do not hesitate to reach out at any time before our meeting to add items to our agenda. 

All participants must review the GSA's Safety Acknowledgement and Participant Disclaimer before attending. 

From Friday, January 23, 2026 9:00 AM to 10:30 AM EST at Zebro - CGP.

item.title: AADMD Fashion Show 2026
item.description:
AADMD Fashion Show 2026

We are excited to announce that AADMD will be hosting the fourth Annual UB Dental Fashion Show this January!

Our chapter of AADMD strives to increase quality and access to healthcare for people with IDDs in the Buffalo and surrounding area. The fashion show will be an inclusive fashion show, with models of all cultures and abilities. We will be inviting individuals from the community with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDDs) to walk as models alongside the students from the School of Dental Medicine. The purpose of the fashion show will be to raise funds to support a community organization that provides services to individuals with IDDs while simultaneously showcasing the beauty of various cultures and abilities in our own community.

From Saturday, January 24, 2026 6:00 PM to 10:00 PM EST at Marriot Hotel.
item.author: rcdebell@buffalo.edu (UB chapter of The American Academy of Developmental Medicine and Dentistry)
item.host: UB chapter of The American Academy of Developmental Medicine and Dentistry

item.title: AIAA DBF (Design Build Fly) Competition (Cancelled)
item.description:
AIAA DBF (Design Build Fly) Competition

UB AIAA is an engineering club that offers students hands-on experience with real-world aerospace challenges. The main project is Design/Build/Fly (DBF), an international competition hosted by AIAA, Textron Aviation, and Raytheon. DBF challenges teams to design, build, and fly a custom radio-controlled aircraft that meets a unique set of mission requirements. Members who have contributed their time, knowledge, and effort to the creation of the aircraft will have the opportunity to attend the DBF competition held in either Arizona or Kansas. This year, it is held in Wichita, Kansas. Those who attend the trip will be able to communicate with peers from a multitude of colleges and talk with companies/people who have found success in the engineering field.

From Monday, September 22, 2025 12:00 PM to Sunday, April 19, 2026 5:30 PM EDT at Textron Aviation Employees‚Äô Flying Club in Wichita, KS.
item.location: Textron Aviation Employees‚Äô Flying Club in Wichita, KS
item.author: buffaloaiaa@gmail.com (UB Chapter American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics)
item.host: UB Chapter American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics

item.title: UB Drone Labs
item.description:
UB Drone Labs

Come hang out with us as we dive into the world of drones! Whether you’re curious about how they work, want to get some hands-on building experience, or just enjoy flying them around, this event is for you. Each session, we’ll explore a different part of drone design, from the basics of flight and control systems to more advanced topics like stabilization and payloads. No experience needed, just bring your curiosity.

From Tuesday, September 16, 2025 12:00 PM to Sunday, May 31, 2026 6:45 PM EDT at Davis 230a.
item.author: ub.robotics@gmail.com (Robotics Club)
